name: Tier 2 Ranged Fumbles (Levels 5-8)
description: Fumble effects for ranged attacks at Tier 2 (Levels 5-8). Effects are more impactful for competent adventurers.

results.text: Nothing Special - Your shot goes wide but you recover with no additional penalty.
Scatter Ammo - In your fumble, you drop 2d4 pieces of ammunition that scatter around you.
Bowstring Snapped - Your bowstring snaps or crossbow mechanism jams. Spend an action to restring or switch weapons.
Torn Muscle - You badly strain your arm. Take 1d6 damage and have disadvantage on ranged attacks for 1 minute.
Completely Exposed - Your awkward position leaves you defenseless. Attacks against you have advantage and you can't take reactions until the start of your next turn.
Disarmed - Your weapon flies from your hands, landing 20 feet away.
Self-Injury - The weapon rebounds and injures you. Take 1d8 damage.
Hit Ally - Your shot hits a nearby ally. Roll attack against ally's AC; on hit, deal weapon damage.
